author: @amdtoon
text:
On that Will Smith point. I'm polyam and people get taken aback but accept it for me eventually.

But the moment they clock that my partner gets with other guys (apparently girls are fine), I start getting funny looks and comments for "allowing" my girlfriend to be with other men

replies.author: @stephe1506
replies.text: The "one penis policy" of the patriarchy is so real even in people's subconscious

replies.author: @ItachiUchiha-sh6of
replies.text:
Its always funny how a girl getting with another girl is not considered cheating or objectionable to a lot of guys.

Imo its like the perfect mix of homophobia and misogyny. I feel like it comes from the idea that lesbian sex isn't real sex. As well as the belief that straight sex inherently places a man in a dominant position. Like he's taking, the woman is receiving. He's gaining/winning while the woman is losing/ being devalued. 

Your partner being with other women doesn't devalue herself while also making you look more valuable. While her getting with other dudes devalues her and makes you a cuck/ weak man. At least that's how I think they rationalize it. Shits weird üòÖ

I 100% agree, my only concern is whether of not the sexual activity was consensual or not. Thank you Olay, for another thought-proving panel!

author: @RetroRealm25
text:
I loved this discussion so much it is quite scary to see how pervasive Patriarchy is to the point that people defend abusers at the expense of black people I knew something was wrong with Diddy not only because of how he mistreated artists and put them in jacked up contracts where he was able to siphon all of their money, but what was most concerning is that we seen this man on nationally TV "Making the Band" forcing people to walk 5 miles for some cheese cake we seen his argument with Laurieann Gibson and that woman was so scared of him that she ran to the police station and filed a police report that should have let everybody know that Diddy was a dangerous man. 

I am not even shocked about cryrese coming to another abusers defense because they are one and the same 2 sides of the same coin they gone always find compassion for the men that they have become. Now the person who really needs to tread lightly is the king of the creep show Stevie J baby we seen you mistreat countless women on TV and we have not forgotten about how your predatory behavior violated a black woman journalist. Aren't you the same dude who was getting fellatio from somebody, while that woman was interviewing you? You need to be focused on gathering up that paperwork because they gone be coming after you next especially if you was participating in the foolishness with Diddy.

author: @avrilrandle5576
text:
I remember someone said, don't remember who but I think it sticks well; that the moment the "good ones" are more valuable to their fascist "friends" as targets than allies that's what they'll immediately become, and we see it happens to all these soulless sellouts, best they can hope for is that moment won't get there within their miserable lifetime. But they don't even get their own safety guaranteed for more than a limited time, and we see it happening so often. 
The price of becoming the token really is too high, you lose your soul immediately and eventually they'll take your life just the same as the rest of ours.

author: @Anti-AntiAintI
text:
Very fun and interesting discussion, as always.

My only issue with leftist content creators and "Black Capitalism"/"Excellence" is that the focus should not be disproportionate. And I often feel like it is, on the internet. You don't have to repeatedly tell us that black billionaires are bad. We get it.

As an anticapitalist it just starts coming off kinda weird that you...

1. Think we're unaware that black capitalism is still capitalism or...

2. Think black capitalism is worse.

Both options are kinda racist and I'm certainly sure many content creators don't mean it that way. But it starts to come off that way. Similar to how class reductionists come off as racist or deeply out of touch, without trying to.

We gotta move forward from denouncing Jay and Beyonce for their gains. And we gotta start being careful about labeling audiences and usernames as black, without proof.

author: @myraclegandy5466
text: I thought the public was overall on Cassie‚Äôs side obviously you had people who said the things you said like why know but I saw people supporting here. With the lil rod case I feel like people are more so making a joke of it. I feel like it‚Äôs more discussed because of homophobia. I think the feds acted on the lil rod case because of the drugs and guns and the shooting allegedly diddy and his son did but I almost feel like the feds have been watching him for years but being a bad business man isn‚Äôt illegal. With the Will stuff I thought it was known they were in a open relationship because they were both publicly dating others remember they linked Jada to Marc Anthony so it wasn‚Äôt a one sided act where only Will had side pieces. Young black Men need to stop looking at what rich men do and be taught that there are other ways to lead a family but unfortunately some women like was said have adopted the white picket fence life that was sold to us on old family shows that‚Äôs why black men get mad and are confused because they aren‚Äôt happy with themselves and a lot of their women aren‚Äôt satisfied with them either.
